annotation.TEXT: Unlike most of the other bosses in the game, Strider isn't exactly a push-over. His attacks deal a rather absurd amount of damage (we're talking about 3 to 4 hit deaths here), and that's not to mention his moves have a rather long reach as well. He's actually one of the few RM's in the game that I wouldn't recommend using Top Spin on (unless you lower his health enough and are absolutely certain you can take him out with it in a few seconds).

Warlock Man seems to be another reference to World of Warcraft (again, I've never really played WoW before, but I did do some research beforehand to find some connection to this). His stage essentially consists of three doorways that lead to different sequences and out-of-place areas, in which you need to pick the correct door to proceed to the next part of the stage. The premise is simple enough, but it becomes a bit frustrating when there's no clear indication in whether or not the door you picked is the correct one.

Not-Jason's stage has a gimmick that involves going through alternate versions of the level via portals. It's an interesting idea, though isn't really used much due to being able to rush through the altered section to reach the boss in roughly a minute. Then again, this is still the demo (I'm hoping a more completed version of this will actually improve upon this idea).

Time for the final set of Robot Masters, most of which are references to other games or media. Dramatic Introduction Man (and yes, that is his real name) doesn't necessarily fall into this category. Instead, I'd put him in the same boat as Otaku Man. It's a nice concept for a parody level, but one that's very empty in this demo so far.

And...That's it. That's about all you can do in this demo so far. The sets of Wily and Final stages are accessible on the menu, but aren't implemented into this version. If they're any indication though (along with some of the game footage maelstormm himself has posted), this game has only just begun to get crazy.

By this point, it should be worth mentioning that I had trouble going into the doors for some reason (as seen here and probably back at the end of Dramatic Introduction Man's stage). I'm not sure why, but despite pushing up several times, I couldn't go through them sometimes. Whether or not this is an issue on my end or with the demo, I'm not sure.

Strider's stage is another I would place as a good candidate for hardest level in the demo (next to Circuitry Man and Mirror Man's stages). There aren't many enemies here, but there is a stage-specific hazard in the form of energy beams. Much like some of the obstacles seen before, these things are a 5-hit kill, and they're practically everywhere through-out the level.
